workflow.name: Automated Instagram commenting on selected profiles with GPT-4o and Phantombuster
workflow.description:
## Who‚Äôs it for  
Influencers and social-media teams who want to *comment automatically on posts from selected Instagram profiles*‚Äîscaling engagement while staying within platform limits.  

## How it works / What it does  
1. **Schedule Trigger** runs every 2 h.  
2. **Profile Post Extractor** fetches up to 20 posts per profile from your CSV.  
3. **Select Cookie** rotates Instagram session-cookies.  
4. **Get Random Post** selects one.  
5. **Create Comment** (GPT-4o) writes ‚â§150-character reply in your chosen language.  
6. Builds `instagram_post_to_comment.csv`, uploads to SharePoint.  
7. **Phantombuster Autocomment Agent** posts it.  
8. Logged in `instagram_posts_already_commented.csv` to prevent repeats.  

## How to set up  
- Same as the auto-liker, but also add `instagram_posts_already_commented.csv` (header `postUrl`).  
- Define tracked profiles in `profiles_instagram.csv`.  
- Configure comment prompt & language in **Set ENV Variables**.  

## Profile CSV format  
Your `profiles_instagram.csv` must contain a header `profileUrl` and valid Instagram profile URLs. Example:  
```csv
profileUrl
https://www.instagram.com/brand_account/
https://www.instagram.com/influencer123/

workflow.name: Instagram Auto Commenting (Profile Post Extractor) - Creators Hub

parameters.content: ## Launch Autocomment Agent to Post Comment

assignments.name: ENV_COMMENT_PROMPT
assignments.value: Erstelle einen ansprechenden Instagram-Kommentar basierend auf dem gegebenen Post-Inhalt.

parameters.text:
=##################  PROMPT  ##################

**ROLE:**  You are a session-cookie selector.

**CURRENT BERLIN TIME**  
Date‚Äâ&‚Äâtime : {{ $now.setZone('Europe/Berlin').format('DD HH:mm:ss') }}  
Hour (00-23): {{ $now.setZone('Europe/Berlin').format('HH') }}

**SESSION COOKIES (keep order):**  
{{ $json.data }}

**SELECTION LOGIC**

1. Let  
   ‚Ä¢ N = number of cookies in the list (2 ‚â§ N ‚â§ 4).  
   ‚Ä¢ H = current hour as an integer (0‚Äì23).  
   ‚Ä¢ W = 24 √∑ N ‚ÄÉ(the width of each time slice in hours, always an integer).

2. Determine the slice index:  
   sliceIndex = floor(H √∑ W)‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ// 0-based

3. Choose the cookie at position *(sliceIndex + 1)* in the list.  
   ‚Ä¢ Example when N = 4 (W = 6):  
     00-05 ‚Üí 1st, 06-11 ‚Üí 2nd, 12-17 ‚Üí 3rd, 18-23 ‚Üí 4th  
   ‚Ä¢ Example when N = 3 (W = 8):  
     00-07 ‚Üí 1st, 08-15 ‚Üí 2nd, 16-23 ‚Üí 3rd  
   ‚Ä¢ Example when N = 2 (W = 12):  
     00-11 ‚Üí 1st, 12-23 ‚Üí 2nd

**OUTPUT FORMAT**  
Return only the selected session cookie value in a valid JSON-Field called "session_cookie", nothing else.

##############################################

parameters.content: ## Start Workflow and Retrieve Session Cookie
## Get Instagram Posts By Custom Hashtag

### 1) Cookie & Hashtag Selection  
**What it does**  
‚Ä¢ Downloads cookie list ‚ûú **Select Cookie** picks one by hour-slice.  

**Credentials**  
OpenAI + SharePoint OAuth2.

**Tweaks**  
‚Ä¢ Add/remove cookies in SharePoint file.

### 2) Scrape Instagram Posts  
**What it does**  
‚Ä¢ **Hashtag Agent** fetches 20 posts for the defined Instagram profiles in the CSV file.  
‚Ä¢ **Get Posts** forwards raw results downstream.

**Credentials**  
Phantombuster API.

**Tweaks**   
‚Ä¢ Adjust scrape depth in the agent UI.

### 3) Comment Generation  
**What it does**  
‚Ä¢ **Get Random Post** selects one post + description.  
‚Ä¢ **Create Comment** (GPT-4o) returns a ‚â§150-char reply.

**Credentials**  
OpenAI.

**Tweaks**  
‚Ä¢ Edit language or style via **Set ENV Variables** / prompt.

### 4) CSV Upload & Auto-comment  
**What it does**  
‚Ä¢ Builds one-row CSV (post URL + comment).  
‚Ä¢ Uploads to SharePoint.  
‚Ä¢ **Auto-comment Agent** posts the reply.

**Credentials**  
SharePoint OAuth2 + Phantombuster API.

**Tweaks**  
‚Ä¢ Rename files/folders in **Upload CSV**.  
‚Ä¢ Replace SharePoint with Drive/Dropbox if preferred.

### 5) Deduplication  
**What it does**  
‚Ä¢ Downloads `instagram_posts_already_commented.csv`.  
‚Ä¢ **Check if in List** skips URLs already commented.  
‚Ä¢ On success, appends the new URL and re-uploads the file.

**Credentials**  
SharePoint OAuth2.

**Tweaks**  
‚Ä¢ Modify duplicate logic if extra columns are stored.

### 6) Rate Limiting & Scheduling  
**What it does**  
‚Ä¢ 2-hour cron + **Wait** nodes keep totals near 80 comments/day
  (8 runs √ó 10 posts).

**Credentials**  
None

**Tweaks**  
‚Ä¢ Edit cron rule or wait durations.  
‚Ä¢ Increase comments/day by raising limits and frequency.

user.name: plemeo
user.bio: Hi, I'm Gerhard from Plemeo. At plemeo.ai, we focus on AI-driven automation and workflow optimization. Our deep expertise with n8n enables us to streamline processes and boost efficiency in software development. This allows us to deliver real, measurable improvements. Curious how plemeo.ai and n8n can benefit your business? Reach out at info@plemeo.de or visit plemeo.ai.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
